title: Burn, Baby, Burn!
text:
Burn, Baby, Burn! is the debut album by <a href="Satanism">Satanic</a> <a href="industrial%20metal">industrial metal</a> band <a href="The%20Electric%20Hellfire%20Club">The Electric Hellfire Club</a>. Released on October 25, 1993 by <a href="Cleopatra%20Records">Cleopatra Records</a>, following Thomas Thorn's departure from <a href="My%20Life%20With%20The%20Thrill%20Kill%20Kult">My Life With The Thrill Kill Kult</a>, the album's lyrical theme ranges from <a href="satanism">satanism</a>, <a href="drugs">drugs</a>, <a href="sex">sex</a>, <a href="psychedelia">psychedelia</a> to <a href="Ricky%20Kasso">Ricky Kasso</a>, the <a href="Son%20of%20Sam">Son of Sam</a>, and <a href="Charles%20Manson">Charles Manson</a>.
Notes.
The album's cover artwork was inspired by the church burnings in Norway during the early 90s.
